newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: South Korea's KEPCO buys April LSWR at $19.93/bbl.
newsitem.headline: South Korea's KEPCO buys April LSWR at $19.93/bbl.

text.p: The Korean Electric Power Corp (KEPCO) has awarded its tender to buy April low sulphur waxy residue (LSWR) to South Korea's Yukong Ltd at $19.93 per barrel on a delivered and duty paid basis, a company official said on Monday.
The official said the awarded price includes freight costs and duty and tax charges.
The 500,000-barrel cargo is for delivery between April 21-25 to the ports of Ulsan and Pusan.
KEPCO last purchased two 500,000 barrel cargoes for delivery March 11-15 and March 27-31 at $1.87 per barrel and $2.23 over Singapore spot quotes, respectively.
The official said this is the first time that KEPCO has purchased LSWR on a fixed price basis, compared to its previous tenders on a floating price basis.
He said KEPCO has had "bad experience" with the volatile published spot quotes in the Singapore spot market, in particular in December 1995.
KEPCO is expected to award its tender to buy LSWR for May delivery next week, the official said.
